title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit

05:25 <martin-h> has joined #xwiki

08:54 <vmassol> good morning  
08:55 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <vmassol> mflorea: ping  
09:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <lucaa> has quit  
09:36 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <vfzevaze> has quit  
09:50 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <mflorea> vmassol: pong  
10:25 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <Pbas> Hello. A quick question: if I have a page with multiple Xwiki.stylesheetExtension object. From another page, can I call only one SSX object with $xwiki.ssx.use("MySpace.MyDocWithSSXObjects", xxxxxx)?  
10:39 <mflorea> has quit  
10:43 <vfzevaze> has quit  
10:43 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> come back marius! :)  
10:50 <vmassol> Pbas: I'm not sure. But are you sure that not all SSX or JSX are pulled if you have more than one?  
10:50 <vmassol> (you can try it)  
10:52 <lucaa> Pbas: not as far as I know it will put all the objects, Except if something has changed on ssx since versions 4.something  
10:52 <lucaa> But maybe you need/can reorganize a bit your ssx objects :D  
10:53 <Pbas> Yes but goal is to call only a piece of CSS instruction and avoid multiple page with a tiny bit of CSS instruction  
10:56 <Pbas> I tried: $xwiki.ssx.use("MySpace.MyDocWithSSXObjects call ALL SSX object attached in the page  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne, vmassol: I've asked msmeria to re-test XWIKI-11892 with the latest snapshot (since I have some troubles with oracle's configuration): he still reproduces the issue  
10:58 <vmassol> :(  
10:58 <gdelhumeau> so my recent change about xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwikipreferences does not fix this  
10:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <Pbas> Then I must add some page+SSX object (a little bit messy)... Thxs.  
11:00 <gdelhumeau> Pbas: I confirm, this behaviour haven't changed  
11:01 <Pbas> Ok thanks you  
11:02 <lucaa> Pbas: really depends on what is the structure of your pages & CSS, but usually I find it not such a bad idea to have multiple CSS, one for each screen of my application, and group the CSS directives by their "scope". This way I can also delete it easier, because I know what it is for, and if the screen is not used anymore, I can delete its CSS as well (otherwise in general it's not very easy to delete the CSS if it's all in one page / file)  
11:03 <lucaa> Pbas: I mean, if you have multiple objects because every object is for one scope, you might as well have multiple pages  
11:07 <Pbas> My purpose is to avoid JS.  In velocity: if $mandatoryField => use SSX MySpace.ShowRedField Else use SSX MySpace.ShowNormalField  
11:10 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:10 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it probably means we fail to save part of what makes Admin user have admin right (it has to be something specific to Oracle so except saving...)  
11:10 <Pbas> It would be more tidy up with something like  use SSX MySpace.ShowField.ObjectssxRed and SSX MySpace.ShowField.ObjectssxNormal. But it deosn't matter  
11:10 <Pbas> \*doesn't  
11:11 <tmortagne> msmeria: it would probably help if you go trough to the DW so that he log get saved in the status and we can look at it, see if there is any error in it  
11:11 <tmortagne> s/he log/the log/  
11:12 <vfzevaze> has quit  
11:13 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <msmeria> tmortagne: ok, I'll attach it to the issue after retesting  
11:23 <martin-h> has quit  
11:31 <msmeria> tmortagne: check my comment for XWIKI-11892  
11:33 <tmortagne> msmeria: sorry I forgot to mention it's not the DW status we need but the installed extension status  
11:33 <tmortagne> the extension install log is stored in the extension status itself, so XE UI main wiki status  
11:36 <msmeria> tmortagne: I'm not sure I follow :) where can I find this file ?  
11:36 <tmortagne> msmeria: you attached the DW status but the DW use extension manager to install and extension and we need this extension status  
11:37 <tmortagne> somewhere in status/extension/action/  
11:37 <vfzevaze> hi there! i am having trouble accessing password values from form fiels: customObject.getProperty("hpqcUserPass").value  
11:38 <tmortagne> s/ install and extension / install an extension /  
11:38 <vfzevaze> can someone please help me out?  
11:39 <msmeria> tmortagne: in the status folder I only have distribution and solr folders  
11:39 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: there is a protection in Property#getValue()  for password, you need programming right to access it  
11:39 <tmortagne> msmeria: that's not possible, that would mean you did not installed the default UI  
11:39 <tmortagne> and the issue is about default UI installation  
11:40 <msmeria> tmortagne: well that's the main issue of XWIKI-11892  
11:40 <msmeria> being unable to complete the installation of the UI  
11:40 <tmortagne> you can always complete it, connect with superadmin for example  
11:40 <msmeria> ok  
11:42 <tmortagne> also it's supposed to complete alone if you wait enought time  
11:43 <tmortagne> there is no reason to have a conflict on a new install  
11:43 <tmortagne> if you have a conflict then that's probably the root cause of your issue and you you mention it  
11:47 <vfzevaze> tmortagne: so is .value the right way?  
11:47 <tmortagne> .value call getValue() yes but unless you have programming right you won't get the password  
11:49 <vfzevaze> got it, @programming right: for the scipr tor user rendering the page?  
11:49 <msmeria> tmortagne: I've attached the status you requested  
11:49 <vfzevaze> because i am running it with the admin user  
11:49 <msmeria> one thin I noticed in the jetty log: 2015-03-19 12:41:36,501 [main] WARN  .e.r.i.l.LocalExtensionStorage - Failed to load extension from file [data\extension\repository\org%2Exwiki%2Eenterprise%3Axwiki-enterprise-ui-admin-user\7%2E0-SNAPSHOT\org%2Exwiki%2Eenterprise%3Axwiki-enterprise-ui-admin-user-7%2E0-SNAPSHOT.xed] in local repository  org.xwiki.extension.InvalidExtensionException: Failed to parse descriptor  
11:49 <tmortagne> msmeria: did you had a conflict ?  
11:50 <msmeria> yes, for XWiki.XWikiAllGroup and XWiki.Admin  
11:55 <tmortagne> I don't understand how you can be asked to login if XWiki.Admin is not saved  
11:57 <vfzevaze> @tmortagne: i have set all the rights for admin, still getting only the hash  
11:57 <tmortagne> msmeria:  anyway you should always mention conflicts since they don't make any sense during a fresh install, also it was the cause of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11854 which you reported  
11:57 <vfzevaze> so do i understand coerrectly that there is now way or workaround to get the value from this password field?  
11:58 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: I tough you were getting nothing  
11:58 <tmortagne> you won't get better that the hash  
11:58 <tmortagne> the password are not stored in clear  
11:58 <vfzevaze> alright  
11:59 <tmortagne> (would be a major security issue)  
11:59 <vfzevaze> is there an api or utils in xwiki to get the true value?  
11:59 <tmortagne> what do you need password for ? maybe there is another way to do what you need  
12:00 <vfzevaze> ok, i am giving the user the possibility to set it's credentials in the admin section of xwiki  
12:00 <vmassol> vfzevaze: when you create a password field  
12:00 <vmassol> you can decide how it's stored  
12:00 <tmortagne> this hash is supposed to be only one way (when safe enough) so no the idea is that nobody should be getting the password from the hash  
12:00 <vmassol> you can store in plain text if you want  
12:01 <vmassol> for example you'll need to do this if you need to pass it to some external server to connect to it  
12:01 <tmortagne> but then anyone who can this this document can also see the password  
12:01 <vmassol> vfzevaze: users can change their passwords in their profile page :)  
12:02 <vmassol> and you don't need the password in clear for that  
12:02 <vmassol> you ask for the old password, you hash it then compare to the hash value in DB and change it  
12:02 <vfzevaze> wait a sec  
12:02 <vfzevaze> those creds are for a macro  
12:03 <vfzevaze> the user will set credentials for the macro to be able to auth itself in a ticketsystem  
12:03 <vmassol> ah  
12:03 <vmassol> then you need to do as I said  
12:03 <vfzevaze> the hash i do understand, thought there is somehow via programming rights an util with the correct salt avaiable  
12:03 <vmassol> in your xclass set the password xproperty to store in clear  
12:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: this will make any user able to see any other user credentials  
12:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: this is what we do for lots of things :)  
12:04 <vmassol> including mail sending  
12:04 <vfzevaze> the hash or plain text?  
12:05 <tmortagne> I would not say "lots of things" and mail sending is one admin password, it's not something the user thing is a personal information...  
12:05 <tmortagne> s/thing/think/  
12:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: and no you won't see the password in clear  
12:05 <vmassol> it's still hidden  
12:06 <tmortagne> it's hidden in the UI  
12:06 <vmassol> (in the object editor and in view mode)  
12:06 <vmassol> in the object editor too  
12:23 <martin-h> has joined #xwiki  
12:25 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
12:39 <vfzevaze> thx for the help guys!  
12:43 <vmassol> vfzevaze: works?  
12:43 <vmassol> brb  
12:56 <martin-h> has quit  
13:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: you might be interested by XWIKI-11943  
13:39 <vmassol> just started looking into it to reproduce  
13:39 <vmassol> thanks  
13:45 <tmortagne> yeah platform is finally blue on jenkins  
13:45 <vmassol> at last! :)  
13:53 <Trefex> has quit  
14:39 <cjd> having a problem building  
14:40 <cjd> Could not find artifact org.restlet.jse:org.restlet.ext.jaxrs:jar:2.0.14  
14:41 <cjd> my settings.xml is the same as http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
14:45 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <cjd> ahh found the problem, the download failed and rather than retry, maven decided to panic and throw an InexperiencedDeveloperException()  
14:46 <lucaa1> has quit  
14:47 <cjd> this explains why travis-ci builds java projects 3 times before concluding that the build really failed  
14:57 <vfzevaze> @vmassol: yes it did work  
15:00 <vfzevaze> @vmassol i am releasing a new extension soon, that will basicly do the same thing as https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/macro-redmine  
15:01 <vfzevaze> my question is if i can move this repo to the xwiki-contrib organisation  
15:02 <vmassol> vfzevaze: cool!  
15:02 <vmassol> and yes of coure you can  
15:02 <vmassol> \*course  
15:02 <vmassol> you just need to ask it by following http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome#HRequestingaproject  
15:03 <vmassol> I'll be pleased to help out  
15:33 <msmeria> has quit  
15:47 <vfzevaze> i will thx  
15:47 <vfzevaze> has quit
